links.title: Applications
links.excerpt: Here are some client-based applications I’ve written.

links.title: Dragsens
links.excerpt: Inspired by an article by Raymond Chen about how to correctly change the Windows mouse drag sensitivity, I wrote a simple utility called dragsens. It’s a small command-line utility that will allow you to change the number of pixels the mouse has to travel before a drag operation is initiated.

links.title: WinDragsens
links.excerpt: In response to a comment regarding the console-based version of the drag sensitivity utility, I’ve created a new version of the utility that includes a graphical interface and a means of testing the drag settings in the interface.

links.title: Pbrain
links.excerpt: The pbrain programming language is an extension I made to the Brainf**k programming language that adds the ability to define and call procedures.

links.title: Web Apps
links.excerpt: Here are some web-based applications I've written.

links.title: Conway's Game of Life
links.excerpt: I realized one day that I had never implemented Conway’s Game of Life, which is something of a rite of passage for young computer-science students. As I opted for a more non-traditional path to the software profession, I somehow missed that fun, even though I’ve made a point of implementing other computer-sciency things like it.

links.title: Barcode Generator
links.excerpt: A simple barcode generator which is badly in need of an update.

links.title: Lisp Interpreter in JavaScript
links.excerpt: This page has suffered from neglect and DOM drift, unfortunately. It used to work quite well in older versions of IE, Firefox, and even Chrome, but lately it’s feeling rather poorly. I’ll be updating the interpreter soon, perhaps even rewriting it, so that it runs like new again and has a little bit better shelf life.

links.title: About
links.excerpt: About this site and its author.

posts.title: FizzBuzz
posts.excerpt: This is just one of those things you have to write, apparently. Here is mine, in C++.

posts.title: Set-Associative Cache in C#, Part 2: Interface Design
posts.excerpt: This is part 2 of a multi-part series on implementing a set-associative cache in C#.

posts.title: Set-Associative Cache in C#, Part 1: Analysis & Initial Design
posts.excerpt: This is part 1 of a multi-part series in which I turn a coding test from an interview into a more appropriate treatment for the true complexity of the exercise.

posts.title: Barbecue and Project Management
posts.excerpt: Going through the process of preparing some smoked barbecue for Memorial Day got me thinking about a few parallels with project management, particularly in the field of software development.
